member.name: T:Concept.Utils.Wpf.ConceptualPanel
member.summary: This panel maintains a collection of conceptual children that are neither logical children nor visual children of the panel. This allows those visuals to be connected to other parts of the UI, if necessary, or even to remain disconnected.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.ConceptualPanel.OnChildrenCollectionChanged(System.Object,System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: For simplicity, this class will listen to change notifications on the DisconnectedUIElementCollection and provide them to descendants through the OnChildAdded and OnChildRemoved members.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.#ctor(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: This collection can be used by a panel to maintain a collection of child elements that are *not* connected to their owner as visual children or logical children.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.Add(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Adds the element to the DisconnectedUIElementCollection

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.Clear
member.summary: Removes all elements from the DisconnectedUIElementCollection

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.Contains(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Determines whether an element is in the DisconnectedUIElementCollection

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the collection into the Array

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.IndexOf(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Returns the index of the element in the DisconnectedUIElementCollection

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.Insert(System.Int32,System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Inserts an element into the DisconnectedUIElementCollection at the specified index

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.Remove(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Removes the specified element from the DisconnectedUIElementCollection

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the specified index from the DisconnectedUIElementCollection

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.RemoveRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the specified number of elements starting at the specified index from the DisconnectedUIElementCollection

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.Initialize
member.summary: The Initialize method is simply exposed as an accessible member that can be called from the ConceptualPanel's Loaded event. Accessing this member via the Children property will implicitly cause CreateUIElementCollection to be called to create the disconnected collection. This method exists because simple access of a property like Count might be optimized away by an aggressive compiler.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.VerifyWriteAccess
member.summary: If the owner is an items host, we need to enforce the rule that elements cannot be explicitly added to the disconnected collection. However, it is still possible to modify the visual or logical "connected" children of a ConceptualPanel while it is an items host by simply calling the AddVisualChild, RemoveVisualChild, AddLogicalChild, or RemoveLogicalChild methods. Logic within ConceptualPanel ensures that any visual children added in this manner will be returned within a GetVisualChild() enumeration.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements in the collection.

member.name: E:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DisconnectedUIElementCollection.CollectionChanged
member.summary: Since the owner of the collection is not the parent of the elements, it needs a mechanism by which to monitor its collection of child visuals. This class provides such notifications via INotifyCollectionChanged.

member.name: T:Concept.Utils.Wpf.LogicalPanel
member.summary: This panel extends ConceptualPanel by ensuring that its conceptual children are also "logical" children. Because certain things like property inheritance and resource resolution work through the logical tree, this allows the disconnected visuals to be connected to the panel's ancestor tree in a logical manner without being part of it's visual tree.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.LogicalPanel.OnLogicalChildrenChanged(System.Windows.UIElement,System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: This class uses the OnLogicalChildrenChanged method to provide notification to descendants when its logical children change. Note that this is intentionally similar to the OnVisualChildrenChanged approach supported by all visuals.

member.name: T:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx
member.summary: A Viewport3D subclass that shields Panel3D from needing to arrange the 3D models in a specific order. For models to be truly transparent, and have the models 'behind' them be visible, they must exist in the Children collection in the opposite order of the way you see them on-screen. The front model must be the last child, and the back model must be the first child (not including the scene's light source).

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.AddToBack(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D)
member.summary: Adds the specified model to the rear of the 3D scene.
member.param: The rear item in the scene.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.AddToFront(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D)
member.summary: Adds the specified model to the front of the 3D scene.
member.param: The front item in the scene.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.GetModelAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the model at the specified model index.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.GetModels
member.summary: Returns an enumerable object with which the models are enumerated, from front to back.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.GetVisualIndex(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D)
member.summary: Returns the index of the specified model where 0 is the front item. If the model is not in the scene, returns -1.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.RemoveAllModels
member.summary: Removes all of the models from the scene.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.RemoveBackModel
member.summary: Removes and returns the back model in the scene.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.RemoveFrontModel
member.summary: Removes and returns the front model in the scene.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.AllowTransparency
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the models in the scene support showing the models behind through them.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.BackModel
member.summary: Returns the model at the back of the 3D scene.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.FrontModel
member.summary: Returns the model at the front of the 3D scene.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.Viewport3DEx.ModelCount
member.summary: Returns the number of Viewport2DVisual3D objects in the Children collection.

member.name: T:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo
member.summary: Holds information about a the source of a drag drop operation.
member.remarks: The class holds all of the framework's information about the source of a drag. It is used by to determine whether a drag can start, and what the dragged data should be.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo.#ctor(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DragInfo class.
member.param: The sender of the mouse event that initiated the drag.
The mouse event that initiated the drag.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the drag data.
member.remarks: This must be set by a drag handler in order for a drag to start.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo.DragStartPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the click that initiated the drag, relative to .

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo.Effects
member.summary: Gets or sets the allowed effects for the drag.
member.remarks: This must be set to a value other than by a drag handler in order for a drag to start.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo.MouseButton
member.summary: Gets the mouse button that initiated the drag.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo.SourceCollection
member.summary: Gets the collection that the source ItemsControl is bound to.
member.remarks: If the control that initated the drag is unbound or not an ItemsControl, this will be null.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo.SourceItem
member.summary: Gets the object that a dragged item is bound to.
member.remarks: If the control that initated the drag is unbound or not an ItemsControl, this will be null.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo.VisualSource
member.summary: Gets the control that initiated the drag.

member.name: M:Concept.Utils.Wpf.IDragSource.StartDrag(Concept.Utils.Wpf.DragInfo)
member.summary: Queries whether a drag can be started.
member.remarks: To allow a drag to be started, the property on should be set to a value other than .

member.summary: Notifies the drag handler that a drop has occurred.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DropInfo.Data
member.remarks:
If the drag came from within the framework, this will hold:
- The dragged data if a single item was dragged. - A typed IEnumerable if multiple items were dragged.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DropInfo.DragInfo
member.summary: Gets a object holding information about the source of the drag, if the drag came from within the framework.

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DropInfo.DropPosition

member.name: P:Concept.Utils.Wpf.DropInfo.Effects
member.summary: Gets or sets the allowed effects for the drop.

member.summary: Returns the index of the last character of the specified line. If the index is greater than the current line count, the method returns the index of the last character. The line-index is zero-based.

member.summary: Returns the width of a text once formatted.
